txt.en:
You have been imprisoned beneath Isengard and must now report to Fâsh, an Uruk-hai charged with maintaining the work of the Saruman's thralls.

<rgb=#FF0000>If you need to resummon your Uruk Overseer, use the Shackles you now have within your inventory and he will appear.</rgb>

'I've assigned someone to keep an eye on you and give you work. If he's not happy with your work, I will hear about it.

'You don't want that, little [placeholder].

'If your overseer wanders off for a spot of grub or a swig of brew, rattle your shackles, and he'd better come running. Don't let me see you without him.'

<rgb=#FF0000>If you need to resummon your Uruk Overseer, use the Shackles you now have within your inventory and he will appear.</rgb>

Fâsh has assigned an Uruk-hai to keep an eye on you in the caverns beneath Isengard and to give you work. If your overseer wanders off for some reason, rattling your shackles should make him come running.

'I did not expect much from you, but you did all right... for a [placeholder]. You must know it is pointless to resist! That's a shame. There's usually some sport in getting the Old Man's thralls to behave.\n\n'Disappointing. But enough of that: time is wasting. You need to come with me. The Old Man wants you.'

Fâsh has assigned an Uruk-hai to keep an eye on you in the caverns beneath Isengard and to give you work. If your overseer wanders off for some reason, rattling your shackles should make him come running.

Fâsh has assigned an Uruk-hai to keep an eye on you in the caverns beneath Isengard and to give you work. If your overseer wanders off for some reason, rattling your shackles should make him come running.

'Talk to your overseer and do the work he asks of you! Rattle your shackles if he has wandered off, and that'll draw him near. If it doesn't, he'll have to answer to me!'

<rgb=#FF0000>If you need to resummon your Uruk Overseer, use the Shackles you now have within your inventory and he will appear.</rgb>
'You have nothing for me.'
Fâsh is in the centre of the caverns beneath Isengard.\n\nYou have finished a series of tasks for your Uruk-hai overseer and should return to Fâsh.
'Talk to your overseer and do the work he asks of you! Rattle your shackles if he has wandered off, and that'll draw him near. If it doesn't, he'll have to answer to me!'

'I did not expect much from you, but you did all right. For a dwarf. You must know it is pointless to resist! That's a shame. The last beard I saw was a fighter. Drew blood, he did, and that's something Fâsh don't forget.\n\n'Good to know you don't have half the fight of that one. But enough of that: time is wasting. You need to come with me. The old man wants you.'
'Talk to your overseer and do the work he asks of you! Rattle your shackles if he has wandered off, and that'll draw him near. If it doesn't, he'll have to answer to me!'
'You have nothing for me.'
Complete 'The Slop' for your Uruk-hai overseer

'I did not expect much from you, but you did all right. For an Elf. If it weren't for my orders, I'd have killed you already! But orders is orders. Shame. Can't stand you pointy-ears.\n\n'Enough of that: time is wasting. You need to come with me. The old man wants you.'
Complete 'Heavy Lifting' for your Uruk-hai overseer
Complete 'Kill Ten Rats' for your Uruk-hai overseer
'You have nothing for me.'
Return to Fâsh in the centre of the caverns
Book 4, Chapter 19: The Caverns of Isengard

'I did not expect much from you, but you did all right. For a halfling. But I've still got a bone to pick with you: you lost me a fistful of silver coins. I had a wager going with some of the boys that you wouldn't still be standing after your first day. Miserable little runt!\n\n'Enough of that: time is wasting. You need to come with me. The old man wants you.'
'You have nothing for me.'
